Key Match Events: Will Smith hit a tying, two-run homer
The Dodgers scored three more runs in the seventh to beat the San Diego Padres 7-2
Freddie Freeman left the game after an awkward collision with Luis Arráez and the first base bag
Pinch-hitter Kiké Hernández singled and took second when Andy Pages reached on catcher’s interference by Kyle Higashioka
Shohei Ohtani singled and Hernández scored and Ohtani was safe at second on Fernando Tatis Jr.’s throwing error
Pages and Ohtani scored on Mookie Betts’ single, making it 5-2
Pages added a two-run, two-strike, two-out homer in the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: Doing it in front of the home fans, beating those guys, winning a series, it’s pretty sweet
The Padres led 2-0 as Joe Musgrove pitched six shutout innings
Post-Match Reflections: I couldn’t be more proud of these guys, they fought and fought and fought and overcame adversity
Musgrove threw a heck of a ballgame, you got to tip your hat right there
Miscellaneous Highlights: A sellout crowd of 52,433, including retired Dodgers star Manny Ramirez, packed Dodger Stadium for the finale of the crucial series between the top teams in the NL West
The Dodgers had not clinched at home since the pandemic-shortened 2020 season, when cardboard cutouts replaced fans
The last time fans were on hand for a clincher at home was 2018
